edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.UserInterface

  • public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the UserInterface, which gather user input and displays data to the screen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserInterface()
      This represents the default constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayStats()
      This method outputs the Player's ammo, health, and Gun to the screen.
      void displayTurn()
      This method draws out the dungeon and its steps as well as the position of the Player.
      int getBattleAction()
      This method gathers user input to decide whether to try to shoot the Enemy or attempt to escape.
      int getWeaponChoice()
      This method prompts the user for a Gun to use for the whole game.
      void manageBattle()
      This method is called when an Enemy is crossed.
      void playTurn()
      This method prompts the user to take a step forward and manages input when battle occurs.
      void run()
      This method represents the game loop for the entire game.
      void simulateEnemyAttack()
      This method manages the Enemy's turn for attack.
      void startGame()
      This method represents a loop that keeps running as long as Player is alive and still in the dungeon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterface

        public UserInterface()
        This represents the default constructor for the class.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method represents the game loop for the entire game. It instantiates the scanner and the GameEngine as well as start the Player off with a Gun and starts the game.

      • getWeaponChoice

        public int getWeaponChoice()
        This method prompts the user for a Gun to use for the whole game. It then returns the integer representation of their choice.
        Returns:
        Integer representation of chosen Gun.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method represents a loop that keeps running as long as Player is alive and still in the dungeon. It also checks for encounters, displays Player data as well as the dungeon, and outputs whether you've won or lost.

      • displayStats

        public void displayStats()
        This method outputs the Player's ammo, health, and Gun to the screen. It also draws the dungeon and the Player's current position.

      • displayTurn

        public void displayTurn()
        This method draws out the dungeon and its steps as well as the position of the Player.

      • playTurn

        public void playTurn()
        This method prompts the user to take a step forward and manages input when battle occurs.

      • manageBattle

        public void manageBattle()
        This method is called when an Enemy is crossed. It manages attacks of ActiveAgents as well as Player's attempt to escape.

      • simulateEnemyAttack

        public void simulateEnemyAttack()
        This method manages the Enemy's turn for attack.

      • getBattleAction

        public int getBattleAction()
        This method gathers user input to decide whether to try to shoot the Enemy or attempt to escape. It then returns the integer representation of that choice.
        Returns:
        Integer representation of choice by user.
